About Me

Hi I am Robert Hung ,
I am a senior at the University of Southern California. Fun fact: At the age of 1, I turned on, played with, and successfully cut vital wires of my dad’s ancient computer. At 5 years old, at my mother’s company, I walked around, curious, and cut off all the electricity in the building.

What does that mean? No need to show me how to do things. I hunt for areas of improvement and dive right in. No Asking Around, No Time Wasted. Always Conscientious. Always Exceeding Expectations.

Most importantly, never stop making positive impact to society. Be as curious as ever.

Student, University of Southern California, The Viterbi School of Engineering

2017 — 2021

Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering, Minor in Computer Science
Organizations: IEEE, Taiwanese Student Association, USC Badminton Club

Software Engineering Intern, EconoMedRx, Los Angeles

June 2020 — present

Responsible for website design/maintenance and development, converting statistical code to work with the website (embed statistical graphs), and machine learning (bootstrap linear regressions, ridge regressions and principal component analysis). Also responsible for sentiment analysis using tools like Twitter API.

Undergraduate Research Assistant, University of Southern California, The Viterbi School of Engineering

May 2020 — present

Funded by the USC Viterbi School of Engineering and worked with Professor Muhammad Naveed on implementing/improving to-be-published MQTT encryption system. Protocol reduces bandwidth consumption and allows for confidential processing on server by encrypting at the application level. Utilizes Yao’s garbled circuits in conjunction with novel cryptographic and system techniques. Responsible for improving code and paper. Using ACM WiSec comments to make modifications. Planning for resubmission. Now looking to utilize the Fully Homomorphic Encryption (FHE) Palisade library.

Volunteer, Tech Easy, Vancouver, Canada

January 2015 — May 2016

Aided the elderly with electronics such as the Mac, PCs and iPhones. Asked open-ended questions to “find what’s wrong.” Came up with solutions on the spot, although having no prior experience at times
